H0.text: Who was US Attorney General from January 1961 until September 1964 and a Senator for New York from January 1965 until June 1968. Robert Byrd

H1.text: Who was US Attorney General from January 1961 until September 1964 and a Senator for New York from January 1965 until June 1968. Nicholas Katzenbach

H2.text: Who was US Attorney General from January 1961 until September 1964 and a Senator for New York from January 1965 until June 1968. Ramsey Clark

H3.text: Who was US Attorney General from January 1961 until September 1964 and a Senator for New York from January 1965 until June 1968. RFK

A4.text: Kennedy was appointed United States attorney general at the age of 35, one of the youngest cabinet members in American history.

A5.text: Kennedy left to run for the U.S. Senate from New York in 1964 and defeated Republican incumbent Kenneth Keating, overcoming criticism that he was a 'carpetbagger' from Massachusetts.
